meanings.definition: To satiate or cloy with food or drink.
meanings.sent1: After the feast, I felt accloyed with all the delicious food.
meanings.sent2: She accloyed herself with too many sweets at the party.
meanings.sent3: The buffet accloyed her to the point of needing a nap.
meanings.sent4: The endless buffet accloyed her like a heavy burden.
meanings.sent5: The rich chocolate cake accloyed her senses with its sweetness.

meanings.definition: To fill to excess or surfeit.
meanings.sent1: The overflowing basket accloyed the room with its abundance.
meanings.sent2: He accloyed his plate with more food than he could eat.
meanings.sent3: The room was accloyed with too many decorations for the party.
meanings.sent4: His mind was accloyed with thoughts of the upcoming exam.
meanings.sent5: The market accloyed his senses with a riot of colors and scents.
